speaker: Facebook posts
vclaim: "President Trump's Wall is less expensive than Obama Kerr."
date: stated on March 20, 2019 in posts online:
title: Will the border wall of Trump cost less than the site of Obamakari?
text: While President Donald Trump is trying to circumvent Congress to finance the border wall, Facebook recently claimed that the border wall would be cheaper than health care.gov, Obamakar market where Americans can compare and buy health plans. "President Trump's Wall is less expensive than Obama Kerr - let it sink!" We read the text of the article published by a group called Spippes on 20 March. We decided to do the math and we reached the opposite conclusion. The article was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) To compare price cards, we destroyed the costs of the border wall and health care.gov. During his campaign, the border wall price was between $6 billion and $7 billion. Then he said it would cost $10 to $12 billion. But recent estimates suggest that it will cost more than that how much more it will depend on design, materials, and the distance it will cover. An internal report from the Ministry of National Security described the barrier as a series of walls and fences that would cost $21.6 billion. The Republican Command estimated that the border wall would require between $12 billion and $15 billion. The Democrats in the Senate predicted the price of $70 billion for the border wall and patrol technology. On January 12, 2021, he wrote in an Instagram article saying that Joe Biden remained silent about the violence in Black Lives-Mite protests. • 16 January 2021, Trump, in his recent budget, requested $8.6 billion to finance the border wall, in addition to $12.9 billion that could be raised after the declaration of a national emergency. But it is important to know that these funds are not guaranteed. Previously, the Obama Health Care Site investigated health care costs.gov, established by the Affordable Care Act. :: During a Senate hearing in May 2014, the then appointed Minister of Health and Human Services, Silvia Matthews Borwell, said that total expenditures amounted to $834 million. Our reports show that the most liberal estimate is $2.1 billion, which is the result of a study by the Bloomberg Government that raised expenditures beyond the Borwell estimates, including $387 million in expenditures by other agencies and a $300 million contract for the processing of paper applications. Why are we comparing these projects? We tried to find out more about the origins of this comparison. A related, but not identical, article published by Brittbart states that annual expenditure on Obama's care programme exceeds the highest estimate of the costs of the border wall. However, the article used the costs of the entire programme, not just its website. It also states that "the website alone costs more than $2 billion" and links to another article on the Bloomberg Government study. Our judgment, no matter how costly the border wall you use - which is widespread, ranging from $12 billion to $70 billion - far exceeds the cost of establishing the Obama website. The highest health-care figure we found was $2.1 billion. We're assessing this statement wrong.
